availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Eddyville, Kentucky, grocer. Caldwell County, Kentucky, native. Married Elizabeth Boyd. Father of Lucy A. Boyd, Eliza J. Boyd, and Helen M. Boyd. Hotel keeper in Caldwell County in 1850. Grocer in Eddyville in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 76; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 100; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, p. 12; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 6; Find A Grave, "C. H. Boyd (1815-1888)," Memorial #67145077, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=67145077 (accessed June 18, 2017).
